knimeNode.name: Kafka Consumer Loop Start
knimeNode.shortDescription: Allows to iteratively poll batches of messages from Kafka and to process them.

fullDescription.intro: In each iteration another batch of messages is consumed from Kafka and processed.

tab.name: Settings
tab.option: An id string to pass to the server when making requests. The purpose of this is to be able to track the source of requests beyond just ip/port by allowing a logical application name to be included in server-side request logging.
A unique string that identifies the consumer group this consumer belongs to.

option.name: Topics
option.p: A pattern or list of topics the consumer has to subscribe to.
A pattern has to be a regular expression as defined here. The topics list has to be in the form topic1,topic2,....

tab.option: If this option is selected, the value of topics will be treated as a pattern, and as a list otherwise.
If this option is selected, an additional column is added to the output table containing information about the name of the topic the message/row originates from.
The size of each batch, i.e., number of rows in the output table.

Determines how to stop the execution of this node.
Never Ensures that the loop execution never stops.
Once message queue is empty Stops the execution once there are no new messages available
The time, in milliseconds, spent waiting in poll request if data is not immediately available.
If this option is selected the consumed messages are converted from String to JSON.

tab.name: Advanced Settings
tab.option: Allows to specify additional consumer related options, e.g., poll interval and session timeout. For further details on the individual options see the tooltip or consult the official Kafka documentation.

ports.inPort: Connection details used to create the Kafka Consumer
ports.outPort: The current batch of consumed Kafka messages
